divs: sighting details about 10 years my boyfriend and i were watching the stars on the banks of the mississippi river.it was a beautiful clear weekend, no clouds whatsoever. we were house sitting for a friend and the river was completely quiet.we were laid back in our lawn chairs when across the river on the grafton, illinois side i noticed an orange glowing star (or so i thought) above the tree line of the bluffs. i pointed it out to him with a lithium flashlight we were using because it was so dark. i thought it must be a planet as it rose above the horizon because it glowed so brilliantly.it appeared to grow larger and i'm not sure at that point if it was because it was getting closer or if it intensified it's lights because i pointed and fixed my flashlight on it. but it did get closer, it began to come directly at us at a slow and steady pace, it came across the river midway across the river it was softball sized at arms length.there was no sound. we were terrified but at the same time transfixed on the object so we just stood there with our arms around each other.it hovered for some time then quickly moved to the missouri side of the river to a marina two houses from the house we were house sitting at where it remained for maybe 60 seconds, it sort of floated with jerky motions and at this point it was basketball sized at arms length it was probably 100 yards away from us, and 30 feet in the air, it hovered between two trees although it was only for a minute it seemed like forever. i kept wondering "why doesn't it do something?"the from behind us a smaller version came from behind the house and very quickly connected with the large object not touching but almost connected by a liquid light. the objects glowed the brightest orange gold almost painful to stare at but we couldn't stop watching they stayed fixed for a minute, they looked like a piece of candy from my childhood (circus peanuts) only the glow from it was something i have never seen before and have never seen since . after hovering it\they seemed to morph into a cylinder shape. the orange glow turned a brilliant white and it almost disappeared into itself dimming from the outside in till it was gone, this happened very quickly maybe 3 seconds. he and i sat on the ground and talked about what we saw and there is no possibility it was any type of commercial aircraft there was no sound before or after. we watched the sky for hours afterwards but saw nothing else. we have talked about it on and off for years but swore we would never go public with it. he passed away last spring so i have decided to talk about it now, as he would have never gone along with it.this first object came from the grafton side of the river and i did some research on the piasa bird a mythical birdlike creature the mississippian\sioux indians claimed came out of the caves on the bluffs, and out of the river and kidnapped people who never returned.i have been obsessed with the memory of this sighting for years and it gives me peace to have it off of my chest now.since the sighting the number 3 has seemed very important, triangles , pyramids.. seem to be something i obsess over. i don't know if it's related to the sighting but i was wondering if anyone else has had the same obsession or if i am crazy.have there been any other sighting reported in recent times in the grafton or portage de sioux areas?

Summary: Memorial day weekend, while house sitting for a friend, my boyfriend and I were watching the stars on the Mississippi River
